info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Elbert, south central Anderson and southwestern Abbeville Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 524 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles west of Abbeville, or 4 miles southeast of Lowndesville, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Calhoun Falls, Lake Secession, Lowndesville, Bobby Brown State Park, Lake Strom Thurmond, Lake Russell, Russell State Park, Broad River Campground and Rice Town. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Russell, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
